Package emissary.util

Class ByteUtil

java.lang.Object
emissary.util.ByteUtil
public class ByteUtil extends Object
Common place for the logic to glue byte arrays back together This is error prone and shouldn't be thought about any more than necessary

    • glue

      public static byte[] glue(byte[] a, int astart, int aend, byte[] b, int bstart, int bend)
      Glue two byte arrays together into one
      Parameters:
      a - the first byte array
      astart - starting position in a
      aend - ending position in a
      b - the second byte array
      bstart - starting position in b
      bend - ending position in b
      Returns:
      the whole

    • glue

      public static byte[] glue(byte[] a, int astart, int aend, byte[] b, int bstart, int bend, byte[] c, int cstart, int cend)
      Glue three byte arrays together into one
      Parameters:
      a - the first byte array
      astart - starting position in a
      aend - ending position in a
      b - the second byte array
      bstart - starting position in b
      bend - ending position in b
      c - the third byte array
      cstart - starting position in c
      cend - ending position in c
      Returns:
      the whole

    • split

      public static List<byte[]> split(@Nullable byte[] a, int pos)
      Split a byte array at the specified position
      Parameters:
      a - the byte array
      pos - the split position (a[pos] goes to the second part)

    • grabLine

      public static String grabLine(byte[] data, int pos)
      Given a byte-array and a start offset, return a string of the bytes between the start position and a carriage return byte. In essence, this is grabbing a line of input where the byte array is composed of several lines of input.
      Parameters:
      data - The byte array of input data.
      pos - The initial start offset.
      Returns:
      A string created from the bytes found from the start offset to the carriage return byte.

    • hasNonPrintableValues

      public static boolean hasNonPrintableValues(byte[] bytes)
      Scans a byte array looking for non-printable values.
      Parameters:
      bytes - the bytes to be scanned.
      Returns:
      whether or not there were non-printable values.

    • sha256Bytes

      public static String sha256Bytes(byte[] bytes)
      Creates a hex string of a sha256 hash for a byte[].
      Parameters:
      bytes - to be hashed
      Returns:
      the hex string of a sha256 hash of the bytes.
